metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14062 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the decode_digit function in puny_decode.c in Libidn2 before 2.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact. USN-3421-1 fixed a vulnerability in Libidn2. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idn - 1.33-2
libidn11 - 1.33-2
libidn11-java - 1.33-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libidn package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.33-2').
